page.title: 18Wardley Wood, Rutland
page.content: Part of the wood lies in the S-W corner of the study area. It is clearly shown in the First Edition of the Ordnance Survey map for Rutland published by David and Charles (2nd impression, 1980). Information about the history and development of the wood was obtained from an unpublished typescript titled{The Eye Brook } {Woodlands: a case study of woodland } {management in East Leicestershire West {Rutland}obtained from the Leicestershire Museum and dated March 1975. At the end of the 19th century the wood was regarded as one of the best coverts in England and was drawn every alternate Saturday durin the hunting season. It was purchased by the Forestry Commission in 1955 and was planted with Norway Spruce, Red Cedar, Eurpean Larch, Oak and Beech.
